data.title: Books Tell You Why, Inc
data.meta_description: Binding: Hardcover Book Condition: Fine in Fine dust jacket Publisher: Boston: Houghton Mifflin Company, 1967.
data.text:
An edition that has some mild wear to the spine edges, otherwise Fine in a dust-jacket of equal value.

In 1751, Sarah Churchill, Duchess of Marlborough, became the first woman to be appointed a British minister. She served as Lord Privy Seal and Secretary of State for the Colonies, during which time she championed the cause of women's rights. Skinner's absorbing and well-researched biography tells the story of one of England's most extraordinary women.; 8vo; 356 pages; $10.00.
